title: Charging - 3 metal spheres with Sphere 3 grounded

content.question:
Spheres <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, shown in the figure, are three identical conducting spheres that have been placed on top of insulating stands. Sphere <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> is connected to ground and is initially neutral, while spheres <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> each have an initial positive charge. The spheres are far enough apart that they do not affect the charge distributions on each other. A student brings the spheres into contact, two at a time, in the following order.

Sphere <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is brought into contact with Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and then returned to its initial position.

Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is brought into contact with Sphere <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> and then returned to its initial position.
Which of the following correctly relates the final net charges <math alttext="Q sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="Q sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="Q sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> of the three spheres?

choices.label: <math alttext="Q sub 1 equals Q sub 2, which equals Q sub 3, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="Q sub 1 equals Q sub 2, which equals Q sub 3, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="Q sub 1 is greater than Q sub 2, which equals Q sub 3, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="Q sub 1 is greater than Q sub 2, which equals Q sub 3, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="Q sub 1 is greater than Q sub 2, which equals Q sub 3, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>
